alert.note: Alert for South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet; West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 03 at 2:37PM MST until January 06 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between one and two feet of snow possible. Winds could gust as high as 75 mph, especially over the higher mountains passes and exposed ridges Tuesday afternoon and evening. * WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass, and Rocky Mountain National Park and the Medicine Bow Range. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Damage to trees and power lines is possible.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet; West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet
